statement.p: The graph below shows a fixed (solid blue) vector \displaystyle{\color{blue}{\vec{{{a}}}}}, and a movable (dashed red) vector \displaystyle{\color{red}{\vec{{{b}}}}}. Click and drag the tip of vector \displaystyle{\color{red}{\vec{{{b}}}}} to move it.

As you move the vector, the value of the dot product \displaystyle\vec{{{a}}}\cdot\vec{{{b}}} will be displayed at the top-left corner of the graph. The measurement of the angle \displaystyle\theta between the vectors is shown at the bottom-left corner.
Sometimes the dot product is a positive number, sometimes it is negative, and other times it is zero. Move the vector to see this happen.
